exercises.title: Combined names
exercises.content:
For this exercise, you will create two variables: first_name and last_name. Then, you will create a full_name variable that is a combination of the previous variables.

Lastly, greet the person using the value of full_name.
exercises.solution:
first_name = "John"
last_name = "Doe"
full_name = first_name + " " + last_name

# Or

first_name = "John"
last_name = "Doe"
full_name = f"{first_name} {last_name}"

print(f"Welcome, {full_name}")

exercises.title: Form data
exercises.content:
In this exercise, you will create variables that represent the personal information of a user. You must create variables to store first name, last name, age, weight, and whether they want to receive the newsletter.

You must use the correct data type and comment what type you used after defining the variable (using "#" to create the comment). For example:
variable = 1 # int

Finally, you will print the a sentence such as "John Jackson is 43 years old, weighs 63.2 kg, and it is True that he wants to receive the newsletter."

Remember to use the values you set in the variables rather than hard-coding them in the print statement.
exercises.solution:
first_name = "John" # String
last_name = "Jackson" # String
age = 43 # Integer
weight_kg = 63.2 # Float
receives_newsletter = True # Boolean

print(f"{first_name} {last_name} is {str(age)} years old and weighs {str(weight)} kg. It is {receives_newsletter} that he wants to receive the newsletter")
